result.execSummary:
The defendant Lavell M Walden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, all costs, assessments and victim witness surcharges. To be paid through  collection by DOC from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to 14CF5483.
*20/20/2017  Eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes:
Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without valid prescription. Random urine screens.
No contact with victim Princess J.
*2/20/2017 No Contact Order with the victim to no violent contact is granted.

Participate and complete anger management and other counseling programs deemed appropriate.
*2/20/2017  to allow defendant an opportunity to obtain AODA counseling with a provider who works with intellectually disabled individuals and also DV counseling in place of anger management with a provider who works with  intellectually disabled individuals; but these alternatives are conditions on whether the options are available to the defendant and whether he has the means to pursue them.  In the absence of either, the Department of Corrections is authorized to make him participate in anger management and any other programs deemed appropriate.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Defendant advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor; and that his voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lavell M Walden

State Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel.

per order dated June 14, 2016, Appeal 2016AP556CRNM (14CF5483) and 2016AP557CRNM (15CF1457), the motion to withdraw is granted. Atty. Kathilynne Grotelueschen is relieved of further representation of Lavell M. Walden. The State Public Defender's Office shall appoint successor counsel within forty-five days. Successor Counsel shall file a notice of appearance in this court within five days of appointment. Sucessor Counsel shall inform this court no later than sixty days from the date of apppointment whether he or she intends to continue with this no-merit appeal, to dismiss this appeal voluntarily to file a postconviction motion, ot take some other course of action. If counsel intends to continue with the no-merit process, counsel should request an extension of the deadline for filing the no-merit report, if neccessary.
per order dated May 20, 2016, Appeal 2016AP556CRNM (14CF5483) and 2016AP557CRNM (15CF1457), these appeals are consolidated.

Defendant Lavell M Walden in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Lavell M Walden in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Private Presentence Investigation reviewed.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.   Additional statements by Princess J., Queen J., and Lavell W., Jr.
AS to count 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 24 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, consecutive to 14CF5483,  with credit for 180 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 15 MONTHS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 9 MONTHS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-Participate and complete Anger Management and other counseling programs deemed appropriate.
-Do not possess or consume any controlled substances without valid prescription; random urine screens.
-NO CONTACT with the victim, Princess J.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence(filed in 14CF5483) and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant is remanded.
Filed:  Pretrial credit; CR-233; Ineligible voting
Independent presentence report filed by Atty Domask.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-25-2015 at 08:15 am.
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Lavell M Walden not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.

Defendant Lavell M Walden in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Lavell M Walden in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
A.M.
State and defendant agreed on a resolution and the court approved.    

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS #1 and #2, are dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNTS #3: (as charged):  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 7-2-2015 at 1:30 pm.  Parties are not requesting a PSI.   mld

Defendant Lavell M Walden in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Lavell M Walden in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
A.M.
Jury panel in court.  Voir dire continued at the hour of 10:00 am. Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Jury out of the box.  In chambers discussions, including strikes for cause, are placed on the record.  Jury in the box.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Princess J.  Exhibits 1 through 6 offered into evidence and received.  Exhibits 1 through 6 is published to the jury.  Exhibits 7 and 8 received.  Jury out of the box.  Off the record discussions placed on the record.  Court recessed for lunch.   mld
